vocabulary.definition: a person who believes in or tries to bring about anarchy; someone who rebels against any authority, established order, or ruling power
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The anarchist refused to follow government rules.

vocabulary.definition: a written order to a bank to pay a stated sum from the drawer's account
vocabulary.exampleSentence: He wrote a cheque for one hundred dollars.

vocabulary.definition: a man of noble rank or high office; a feudal superior; a master
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The lord of the manor lived in a grand castle.

vocabulary.definition: not causing or involving pain; easy and simple
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The dentist promised a painless procedure.

vocabulary.definition: the supposed communication of thoughts or ideas by means other than the known senses
vocabulary.exampleSentence: She seemed to know what I was thinking through telepathy.

vocabulary.definition: a former British coin worth one twentieth of a pound or twelve pence
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The book cost two shillings and sixpence.

vocabulary.definition: the wife or widow of a duke; a woman holding a rank equivalent to duke in her own right
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The duchess attended the royal ball.

vocabulary.definition: without a head; lacking a leader or direction
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The headless horseman rode through the night.

vocabulary.definition: a woman engaged to be married
vocabulary.exampleSentence: He introduced his fiancée to his family.

vocabulary.definition: a transparent tank of water in which fish and other water creatures and plants are kept
vocabulary.exampleSentence: We visited the aquarium to see tropical fish.

meditasyonlar.storyAcıklama: A ghost story by Oscar Wilde.
